resources.string: Use the new NWS API for 7 day forecasts. If having issues with 7 day forecasts you can turn this off to use the older method.
Use the new NWS API for Hourly forecast. If having issues with hourly forecasts you can turn this off to use the older method.
Toggle items on or off from showing in the main screen navigation drawer if that UI mode is selected.

Instead of using tabs on the main screen use a navigation drawer. You can then tab the plus icon bottom right or swipe from the left to open the drawer. This option may be better for people who like to navigate by text instead of picture.
If using a navigation drawer on the main screen have it open from the right.

Show WPC Fronts and pressure highs and lows. The data is not realtime but rather forecast data from NWS WPC. You can long press (press and hold) in nexrad radar and you will see the timestamp for the current data. For example "WPC Fronts: 0107 1200Z" would indicate January 7, 12:00 in GMT. Blue is for cold fronts and high pressure centers. Red is for warm fronts and low pressure centers. Light brown is for troughs which could be a trough, outflow boundary, squall line, or dry line. Stationary fronts are alternating red and blue. Occluded fronts are pink.
If location marker follows GPS is enabled this will keep the radar centered on your current location when enabled.
Minimum time in seconds between GPS updates if GPS and auto-refresh enabled.
Size of the normal size text. Default is 16. Large and small font are relative to this as well. A full manual app restart might be required for this (for now). Work in progress.
Prevent tapping on a widget from opening the app. Please note that after changing this setting you must then delete and re-add any widget that you want this to take effect for.
Show a floating action button on the main screen for access to radar.
Hide the top toolbar on the main screen.
Remember the last WFO (Weather Forecast Office) used for the WFO text product viewer. This viewer is accessed via the \"i\" with circle around it in the toolbar or navigation drawer.
Show 7 day forecast in 4x1 CC widget if widget is expanded.
Allows one to hide or show the voice recognition icon on the main screen. Off by default.

With observations or wind barbs enabled if you zoom in closely on an obs site the detailed METAR will appear. This setting controls how close you need to zoom. Lower numbers will show detailed METAR without having to zoom in as far. Default is 7.
Use a dataset 4 times larger then the default county dataset: cb_2015_us_county_5m.kml
If enabled and displaying base velocity tapping on the velocity icon again will show Level2. Once Level2 is shown tapping on icon again will show Level3. Same applied to base reflectivity.
Show SPC Day 1 Convective Outlook outlines.
Controls the size of the nexrad widget. Default is 10. Setting to 5 will zoom out by 2x.
Use a dataset 9 times larger then the default state dataset: cb_2015_us_state_500k.kml This is useful for those looking for accurate coastlines.

On first start, the built-in color palettes are shown with a yellow label. The currently active color palette is shown in the title area and can be changed by tapping any icon. To create a new color palette, select the palette you want to use as a base and then touch the action button in the lower left. From there you are in the editor and a name has been chosen for you at top that you can modify. After you have made changes tap the check mark icon to save. Once you leave the editor a new icon will be generated based on your color palette. The label is in white to show this is a custom palette. If you chose the custom palette by tapping on it a trash icon will appear in the lower right allowing you to delete it and the plus icon will change to a different icon indicating you can edit instead of clone with the current selected palette.

Use JNI ( native C code ) for performance sensitive areas in radar. Although this performs better for fast animations, in general it is not as robust as the default Kotlin based code. If this works without any crashes that is great but if not I recommend to turn it off. It was helpful in the 2014-2017 time frame but as devices have gotten faster the need is not as great. All future development is occurring in the Kotlin code base.
Show nearby observations for the state the currently selected radar is in.
Show nearby wind barbs for the state the currently selected radar is in.
Set the line width for the drawing and distance tools available in radar. Default is 3.
Set the color legend width in radar. Default is 50.
Set the color legend text size in radar. Default is 10.
Nexrad radar single pane activity will have transparent toolbars if enabled.
Nexrad radar single pane activity will have transparent status bar if enabled.
Nexrad radar single pane activity will have the status bar and navigation bar hidden

Use screen recording technology for sharing in activities involving just images and offering animations. After touching the record button in the upper right of the screen touch the same area to stop the recording. Media can be accessed via the notifications or via a file-manager in the DCIM or Movies folder.
Determines whether nexrad radar will be shown during a drag/pan motion.
Determines whether storm spotters are shown along with radar. Color and size for storm spotter markers can also be configured.
Determines whether borders for Canada and Mexico should be displayed. Without this setting enabled the state borders is roughly 800KB. With this setting enabled the combined borders is roughly 1.5MB.
Show centered labels for each county.
Show additional roads when zoomed in. This additional dataset is roughly 3.0MB in size.
Used as a scale factor for the text overlays on the main radar interface. Default is 10. Larger values result in larger text. If 20 is chosen the text labels will be twice as big as the default.
Determines the number of frames the play icon will show in the bottom toolbar.
Turn on your Spotter Network Location reporting.
Determines whether storm spotter labels are shown along with radar.
if set to true, The Spotter labels will show Last names only instead of both first and last names.
Configure size of storm spotters on radar.
Configure size of the circle at the end of wind barbs if configured. Default is 7.
If set to true the lightning icon on the bottom toolbar of the main screen will show the dual-pane radar instead of the traditional single pane radar.
Location dot will use the GPS of your device and will also keep the screen on and refresh data according to the refresh interval setting which is 3 minutes by default.
add heading bug to your GPS location if you are following your GPS.
If in a multi-pane radar mode each pane will share the same zoom lat/lon provided they are using the same radar site.
Remove line breaks used to keep NWS text products at fixed width. This will make headers harder to read but the body of the text will more easily adapt to the size of your screen.

The Nexrad radar interface allows pinch zoom, double tap to zoom in, single tap to zoom out, long press on the screen to bring up a contextual menu allowing you to do a variety of things. A number of radar products and animation options are available in the toolbar menu. "Tools -> Radar" (also available from the main screen as "Settings -> Radar") can be be used to enable a variety of layers such as warnings and watches.

When "Share / Drawing Tools" is selected from the sub-menu, a recording toolbar appears in the top right of the screen. You will need to approve and enable various Android permissions to allow this to happen. In the recording toolbar at the top, options exist for a drawing tool and with single pane radar a distance tool. When the drawing tool or distance tool are engaged, you are not able to pan or zoom the radar. When you stop the drawing tool all markings are removed. You can also use the "X" to close the toolbar which will clear the distance and/or drawing tool markings. Default color is red but is configurable in settings->colors. The width of the line is also configurable.

For screen recording and screenshots files can be shared and are written to your SDCARD in “Android/data/joshuatee.wx/files/Movies" and "DCIM”. All users will notice a popup requesting permission to record the screen. You may need to tap “share” multiple times to enable all of the necessary permissions. After the first time it will come up on first touch. To use this new feature simply select “Shared / Drawing Tools” from the submenu in single or multi-pane nexrad radar and you will notice a floating and persistent set of icons in the upper right which allows you to exit the icon pane, take a screenshot, and record a video respectively. If you take a video by default the video will start immediately ( a 3 second delay can be enabled in Settings->Radar->Screen Recorder ). Once the recorder is running the icons will disappear ( since you are literally getting everything on the screen including any panning/zooming or product changes ). To stop the recording simply tap the screen in the same location the recording used to be. Once a video or screenshot have been captured a notification will fire and from there you can view or share the given media file.

Display warning polygons for tornado, severe thunderstorm, and flash flood. This will cause a periodic task to run in the background and pull data. Interval can be set under settings -> Notifications.
Display SPC Watch or MCD polygons. This will cause a periodic task to run in the background and pull data. Interval can be set under settings -> Notifications.
Display WPC MPD polygons. This will cause a periodic task to run in the background and pull data. Interval can be set under settings -> Notifications.
Display city markers or labels depending on product.
Show highways.
Show significant lakes.
Toggle location ( as in current selected location on first tab ) dot on/off.
Use a white or black background in as many radar products as possible.
Animation speed. Lower is faster. Default is 8.
Thickness of lines for State, Rivers, highways Lines. Smaller is thinner.
Thickness of lines for warnings. Smaller number is thinner.
Thickness of lines for SPC Watch/MCD. Smaller number is thinner.
Thickness of lines for state lines. Smaller number is thinner.
Thickness of lines for county outlines. Smaller number is thinner.
Thickness of lines for main highways. Smaller number is thinner.
Thickness of lines for secondary highways/roads. Smaller number is thinner.
Thickness of lines for rivers and lakes. Smaller number is thinner.
Thickness of lines for the GPS location circle. Smaller number is thinner.
Thickness of lines for storm tracks. Smaller number is thinner.
Thickness of lines for the SPC Convective Outlooks. Smaller number is thinner.
Thickness of lines for WPC Fronts. Smaller number is thinner.
Thickness of lines for wind barbs. Smaller number is thinner.
Allows one to change the size of the location marker.
Allows one to change the size of the GPS location Image.
Allows one to change the size of the GPS location Bug.
Allows one to change the default view size for the WXOGL Nexrad radar interface. Larger value is more zoomed in.
Turn on alerts for US-wide tornado warnings.
Turn on alerts for US-wide SPC Mesoscale discussions.
Turn on alerts for US-wide SPC Watches.
Turn on alerts for US–wide SPC convective outlooks. Days 1–3 are inspected for high, moderate, or enhanced risk.
For convective outlooks in Days 1–3 also notify if slight risk is present.
Turn on alerts for US-wide WPC MPDs.
Turn on alerts for Eastern Pacific NHC advisories. Individual storm\'s notifications can be muted via the submenu in the activity that presents details for a particular storm.
Turn on alerts for Atlantic NHC advisories. Individual storm\'s notifications can be muted via the submenu in the activity that presents details for a particular storm.
Turn on sound for this notification.
Turn on sound for this notification.
Turn on sound for this notification.
Turn on sound for this notification.
Turn on sound for this notification.
Turn on sound for this notification.
Turn on sound for this notification.
Turn on sound for this notification.

Interval to use for checking all notifications. This also impacts widgets and the value should be lower then the widget check interval. If this value is set to the highest value possible - 121 - it will completely disable the background check mechanism if you are running Android 7.0 or higher.
Notifications will not be persistent and will only display once for the life of the event
If a notification is clicked on it will cancel the notification.
Disable sound ( if used ) between certain hours as specified.
Ignore blackout (of sound) if it is a local Tornado warning.
Start of blackout (sound, alert will still show).
End of blackout (if configured sound will now resume if there is an alert).
If enabled any notification that has sound configured will play the sound continuously until the notification is acknowledged.
If enabled notifications title will be audibly read via Android text to speech engine. Feature is considered beta.

Check for SPC MCD or Watches along with Severe Thunderstorm warnings and Tornado warnings at the selected interval. The text in the tab headings is then modified. This also requires a periodic job run at the notification interval to download warning data.
Check for WPC MPD at the selected interval. The text in the tab headings is then modified. This also requires a periodic job run at the notification interval to download warning data.
Enable and show Userpoints on the radar to mark your custom locations.
Check for internet connection on your device.

Check for Severe Thunderstorm, Flash Flood, and Tornado warnings at the selected interval. The text in the tab headings is then modified. This also requires a periodic job run at the notification interval to download warning data.
The default theme is BlackAqua. For those who do not like this you can select an alternate.
Use fullscreen when viewing content as much as possible.
Only the first tab will be available along with all action bar items. Can be used to present a more simplistic weather application.
Use Fahrenheit instead of Celsius in current conditions.
Use Millibars instead of inches.

Interval for updating current conditions and seven day for selected location. Setting this to 0 will disable updates on the homescreen. The only way to trigger updates aside from app restarts would be to touch the status text under the current conditions.
Check interval for widget data in minutes. This interval is also used for the current conditions and 7day notifications. The default is 30 minutes.
Controls whether nexrad radar data should be downloaded.
Controls whether vis sat data should be downloaded.
Controls whether radar mosaic data should be downloaded.
Controls whether WFO AFD data should be downloaded.
Controls whether WFO HWO data should be downloaded.
Choose which location is used for widget data.
Center the nexrad site in a specific quadrant of the image.
Show NWS weather alerts for this location.
Show current conditions via a notification for this location. The interval at which this is checked is configured in settings->widgets.
Show 7 day forecast via a notification for this location. The interval at which this is checked is configured in settings->widgets.
Controls whether notifications for this location are audible
Controls whether a radar image notification is presented when a weather alert is present. Must have NWS weather alerts enabled.
Controls whether a notification is generated when an SPC MCD is active for the current location.
Controls whether a notification is generated when an SPC convective outlook risk is active for the current location.
Controls whether a notification is generated when an SPC fire outlook risk is active for the current location.
Controls whether a notification is generated when an WPC MPD Is active for the current location.

If selected the toolbars will not have the ability to be hidden on demand. If in an activity with a text product or a text product and an image you an tap on the text product to hide/show the toolbars. If the activity only has an image you can tap to hide/show the toolbars.
Translate NWS abbreviations in text products.

This activity can be used to add or modify an existing location. To add a new location you can use the magnifying glass icon to search for a new location. A successful search will populate the latitude and longitude fields with good values. If you choose a location that is suggested via autocomplete then it will automatically populate the label, lat, lon, and save the location. If a suggested city was not selected you can edit the location label if desired and then use check icon to save the location. Additionally, you can touch the GPS icon to populate the lat/lon fields if you have location services enabled. You should see one popup message after the location has been saved. On this screen you can also toggle notifications on or off for this specific location.
Enable counties to be displayed.

If enabled the WXOGL activity will attempt to prevent the screen from turning off and will auto refresh roughly every 3 minutes ( by default ). Interval is configurable. Additionally, the GPS will be queried to show your current location on the radar.
If enabled the WXOGL radar will show storm tracks ( predicted future path / speed ).
If enabled the WXOGL radar will hail signatures with hail size at or greater then 0.50 inch at 50% or higher probability.
If enabled the WXOGL radar will hail signatures will show text of hail sizes
If enabled the WXOGL radar will show tornado vortex signature as shown via upside down triangle with color matching tornado warning/watch polygons.
Allows one to change the size of the Hail markers.
Allows one to change the size of the Hail Text.
Allows one to change the size of the TVS markers.
Allows one to change the size of the Userpoints markers.
Nexrad Radar will use the last location / product / zoom level / position viewed instead of the radar site for the current location in the main tab.
Controls the number of minutes before an auto refresh is triggered if that option is enabled.
Control how much elevation is present in the UI. Default is 3.

This activity is used to manage the cards on the \"home page\" (the first screen shown when the app is launched). Tap on any entry to delete or move up and down. The plus floating action button is used to add text products while the map icon is used to add image based products. The \"i\" with a circle around it is used to add an AFD product for a specific location that will not change when the selected location is changed. The lightning bolt allows you to add additional OpenGL based nexrad radars. You can reset the cards shown to the default with the last entry under the submenu. Please note that any change in this list will require an app restart and after restart you will be in the main settings activity.
Controls the speed of text to speech, higher is faster. Default is 10.
Controls the size of the NWS icons used in homescreen widgets CC2 or 7DAY2. Larger devices such as tablets could have this value lowered depending on screen size. Default is 24.
Set the length in characters of textual cards on the homescreen when not expanded. Default is 500.
Set the radius of any card widget. Larger numbers create a more rounded corner. Default is 0, no curve.
Set the number of images tiles in the 2nd and 3rd tab. Default is 3. Requires an app restart.
Please make sure notifications are explicitly allowed if you enable any items below. If using Android 13 or higher, tap here to allow permissions.
